title: Global top 100 finalist
subtitle: Google Solution Challenege
text: My team built Disaster Rapid Response, a portal which provides disaster damage heatmaps by analyzing aerial imaging of affected areas for rapid relief response, and allows transfer of financial aid through blockchain based on estimated damages.

title: Second place winner
subtitle: D3 Techno-management Hackathon
text: I built a mess portal where students can buy their desired coupons, with a QR code system and Razorpay integration. Owners can set their weekly menu, price, time, and view meals to be cooked for the day.

title: Global 300 with 800k+ points
subtitle: Google HashCode
text: This was a competitive coding contest where I had to optimize the traffic flow of a city using the given data. It tested us on concepts of DSA, and OOPS. I ranked within the top 300 globally among 5000+ participants.

title: Regional finalist
subtitle: GFG Solving for India Hackathon
text: My team build a web app which enables users to take a picture of their refrigerator contents, detects the ingredients present, factors in their allergies, and dietary styles, and then recommends healthy recipes they can make at home.

title: Global rank 120
subtitle: CodeChef September Long
text: I regularly participate in competitive coding contests on CodeChef to improve my problem solving skills and brush up my concepts of data structures and algorithms. Python, Java, and C++ are my languages of choice.

title: Finalist
subtitle: In several other hackathons
text: I have qualified for finals in hackathons like DevBhoomi Cyber Hackathon, Smart India Hackathon, Flipkart GRiD, and more. I have worked on projects ranging from web apps to machine learning models.
